text: Job’s Final Defense Continued
“I made a covenant with my eyes,
so\f + \fr 31:1 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* how could I look closely upon a virgin?
And what \add is\add* the portion of God from above
or\f + \fr 31:2 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* the heritage of Shaddai from on high?
Is not disaster for \add the\add* evil one
and ruin for \add the\add* workers of mischief?
Does he not see my ways
and count all my steps?
“If I have walked with falseness,
and my foot has hastened to deceit,
let him weigh me in \add the\add* balance of justice,
and let God know my blamelessness.
If my steps have turned aside from the way,
and my heart has walked after my eyes,
and my hand has clung to a spot,
let me sow, and let another eat,
and let my crops be rooted out.
“If my heart has been enticed by a woman,
and at my neighbor’s doorway I have lain in wait,
let my wife grind for another,
and let other \add men\add* kneel over her,
for that \add is\add* a shameful act,
and that \add is\add* ⸤a criminal offense⸥.\f + \fr 31:11 \ft Literally “an iniquity of judges” \f*
Indeed, that \add is\add* a fire that will consume up to Abaddon,
and it would uproot all my crop.
“If I have rejected my male or\f + \fr 31:13 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* female slave’s case
when their complaint \add was\add* against me,
then\f + \fr 31:14 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* what shall I do when God rises up?
And when he enquires, how shall I answer him?
Did not he \add who\add* made me in the womb make them?
And did not one fashion us in the womb?
“If I have withheld \add the\add* desire of \add the\add* poor from \add them\add*,
or\f + \fr 31:16 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I have caused \add the\add* widow’s eyes to fail,
or I have eaten my morsel ⸤alone⸥,\f + \fr 31:17 \ft Literally “to alone me” \f*
and \add the\add* orphan has not eaten from it
(for from my childhood he\f + \fr 31:18 \ft Probably referring to “the orphan” \f* ⸤grew up with⸥\f + \fr 31:18 \ft Literally “reared” \f* me like a father,
and from my mother’s womb I guided her\f + \fr 31:18 \ft Probably referring to “the widow” \f*),
if I have seen \add the one who\add* perishes because of no clothing
or\f + \fr 31:19 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add that\add* there is no covering for the poor,
if his loins have not blessed me,
or\f + \fr 31:20 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* by means of my sheep’s fleece he has warmed himself,
if I have raised my hand against an orphan
because I saw my supporters at the gate,
\add then\add* let my shoulder blade fall from \add my\add* shoulder,
and let my arm be broken from its socket.
Indeed, the disaster from God \add was\add* a dread for me,
and ⸤I was powerless⸥\f + \fr 31:23 \ft Literally “I was not able” \f* because of his majesty.
“If I have made gold my trust,
or\f + \fr 31:24 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I have called fine gold my security,
if I have rejoiced because my wealth \add was\add* great
or\f + \fr 31:25 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* because my hand found a fortune,
if I looked at \add the\add* sun when it shone
or\f + \fr 31:26 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* \add at the\add* moon moving \add in\add* splendor,
and ⸤I was secretly enticed⸥,\f + \fr 31:27 \ft Literally “it was gullible in the secrecy of my heart” \f*
and ⸤my hand threw them a kiss⸥,\f + \fr 31:27 \ft Literally “my hand kissed for my mouth” \f*
this also \add is\add* an iniquity \add to be\add* judged,
for I have deceived God above.
“If I have rejoiced at \add the\add* ruin of \add the one who\add* hated me
or\f + \fr 31:29 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* have exulted when evil overtook him—
no,\f + \fr 31:30 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I have not allowed my mouth to sin,
to ask his life with a curse.
⸤Have the people of my tent not said⸥,\f + \fr 31:31 \ft Literally “If the people of my tent have not said” \f*
‘⸤O that⸥\f + \fr 31:31 \ft Literally “who shall give” \f* someone\f + \fr 31:31 \ft Or “he” \f* had not been satisfied with his meat’?
An alien has not lodged in the street;
I have opened my door to the traveler.
⸤Have I concealed⸥\f + \fr 31:33 \ft Literally “If I have concealed” \f* my transgressions as \add other\add* human beings
to hide my iniquity in my bosom
because I dreaded \add the\add* great multitude,
and \add the\add* contempt of clans terrified me,
so that I kept quiet, I did not go out of \add the\add* doorway?
⸤O that⸥\f + \fr 31:35 \ft Literally “Who shall give” \f* ⸤I had⸥\f + \fr 31:35 \ft Literally “for me” \f* someone hearing me!
Here is my signature;
let Shaddai answer me!
⸤As for⸥\f + \fr 31:35 \ft Hebrew “And,” or “But” \f* \add the\add* written communication \add that\add* ⸤my adversary⸥\f + \fr 31:35 \ft Literally “the man of my indictment” \f* has written,
I would ⸤surely⸥\f + \fr 31:36 \ft Literally “if not” \f* carry it on my shoulder;
I would bind it on me \add like\add* a crown.
I would give him an account of my steps;
I would approach him like a noble.
If my land has cried out against me,
and its furrows have wept together,
if I have eaten its yield without payment,
or\f + \fr 31:39 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I have caused \add the\add* breath of its owners to die,
let thorns grow in place of wheat
and noxious weeds in place of barley.”
The words of Job are ended.
